title: How to Sign Out of a Google Account on Desktop & Mobile

steps.title: Go to https://www.gmail.com in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.gmail.com in a web browser. This displays your Gmail inbox. This method works if you are only signed in to one Gmail account on your computer.

steps.title: Click your profile icon.
steps.content: Click your profile icon. It's the circle on the top-right side of the page. If you don't have a profile photo, you'll see your first initial here instead. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Sign out at the bottom of the menu.
steps.content: Click Sign out at the bottom of the menu. This logs you out of Gmail in this web browser. Google Chrome users only: You'll see a message that says "Your bookmarks, history, passwords, and more are no longer being synced to your account." This is because Gmail is integrated with the browser. Click Continue to confirm, and keep in mind that your Google account is no longer syncing to your other devices as long as you stay signed out.

steps.title: Remove your account from the sign-in screen (optional).
steps.content: Remove your account from the sign-in screen (optional). If you don't want to keep your account name on the Gmail sign-in screen, click Remove an account , and then click the red minus sign next to your name. To confirm, click Yes, remove . If you were signed in to other Google services in this web browser, such as Google Maps or Google Photos, you will also be signed out there.

steps.title: Go to https://www.gmail.com in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.gmail.com in a web browser. This displays your Gmail inbox. This method works if you are only signed in to one Gmail account on your computer.

steps.content: Click your profile icon. It's the circle on the top-right side of the page. If you don't have a profile photo, you'll see your first initial here instead. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Sign out of all accounts at the bottom of the menu.
steps.content: Click Sign out of all accounts at the bottom of the menu. This signs you out of all of your Gmail accounts in this web browser. Unfortunately, there's no way to sign out of just one account if you have multiple Gmail accounts signed in on your computer. steps.title: Log back in to any account(s) you want to stay logged in to.
steps.content: Log back in to any account(s) you want to stay logged in to. Choose the account(s) you want to sign back in to on the login screen. You should automatically log in if the login information is saved with Google.

steps.title: Open the Gmail app on your phone or tablet.
steps.content: Open the Gmail app on your phone or tablet. It's the white icon with a multicolored "M." The only way to sign out of Gmail on your iPhone or iPad is to completely log out of your Google account. [2] X Research source This means you'll also be signed out of other Google apps, including Drive, Maps, and the standard Google app.

steps.title: Tap your profile photo.
steps.content: Tap your profile photo. It's at the top-right corner. If you don't have a profile photo associated with your account, you'll see your first initial instead.

steps.title: Tap Manage accounts on this device.
steps.content: Tap Manage accounts on this device . This option is near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Remove from this device.
steps.content: Tap Remove from this device . A confirmation message will appear, asking if you really want to remove the account. When you confirm, you'll be signed out of all Gmail apps on your phone or tablet. You can always sign back in at any time. If you're signed in to multiple accounts, you'll need to tap Remove from this device for each account you want to remove.

steps.title: Tap Remove to confirm.
steps.content: Tap Remove to confirm. This signs you out of Gmail and all other Google apps.

steps.title: Open the Gmail app on your phone or tablet.
steps.content: Open the Gmail app on your phone or tablet. It's the white icon with a multicolored "M." The only way to sign out of Gmail on your Android is to remove the account from your phone or tablet. Since your Android is deeply integrated with your Google account, you won't able to do much on your phone or tablet after signing out until you sign back in with a Google account. Removing your account doesn't delete itâ€”you can always sign back in to Gmail and other Google services whenever you'd like.

steps.title: Tap your profile photo.
steps.content: Tap your profile photo. It's at the top-right corner of Gmail. If you don't have a photo, you'll see your first initial instead.

steps.title: Tap Manage accounts on this device.
steps.content: Tap Manage accounts on this device . This option appears on the menu. If you just want to add another account to Gmail and not sign out of the current one, you can tap Add another account here instead, and then follow the on-screen instructions to sign in to Gmail with that account.

steps.title: Select the account you want to sign out of.
steps.content: Select the account you want to sign out of. Once selected, you'll see the account removal option. If you have multiple accounts logged in to Gmail, you will need to remove each separately.

steps.title: Tap Remove account.
steps.content: Tap Remove account . A confirmation message will appear, letting you know that you'll be signed out of all Google services on this Android.

steps.title: Tap Remove to confirm.
steps.content: Tap Remove to confirm. You are now signed out of all Google services on your Android.

steps.title: Click or tap on your profile photo in Gmail.
steps.content: Click or tap on your profile photo in Gmail. It's at the top-right corner of Gmail. If you don't have a photo, you'll see your first initial instead. This method works on your computer, Android, or iPhone/iPad.

steps.title: Click or tap Manage your Google account.
steps.content: Click or tap Manage your Google account . It's the button right underneath your profile photo (on a computer) or your account info (on mobile).

steps.title: Click or tap Security.
steps.content: Click or tap Security . On a computer, it's in the left-hand sidebar, and the option has an icon of a lock. On mobile, you'll have to scroll horizontally to find the Security tab.

steps.title: Click or tap Manage all devices.
steps.content: Click or tap Manage all devices . You may have to scroll to find this option. It's under the "Your devices" heading.

steps.title: Click or tap one of the devices.
steps.content: Click or tap one of the devices. Google will list all of the devices where your Google account is signed in, split up by device type (such as Windows computers, Mac computers, Android phones, iPhones, smart TVs, gaming consoles, and more). Next to each device type, the specific device model will be listed. When you click or tap on a device, Google may ask you to sign in to verify your identity.

steps.title: Click or tap Sign out.
steps.content: Click or tap Sign out . Clicking or tapping on a device will show details about the device, as well as when you first and last signed in using that device. The Sign out button is located under all of that information. After clicking or tapping Sign out , click or tap Sign out again to confirm your choice. You may be notified that a third-party app still has access to your account on that device. Click or tap OK to close out of the message, or click or tap Manage app access to remotely revoke app access with your Google account.
